title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox, also sending prospect David Sandlin in the deal.
In return, Red Sox receive minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and send cash to the White Sox.
Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Red Sox; trade considered a salary move.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The Something in the Way festival features two dozen indie bands at Roadrunner in Boston.
Day 1 performances included The Hotelier, Her New Knife, and February, captured by photographer Ben Stas.
The festival spans various indie genres, from emo to screamo, showcasing diverse musical acts.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots fullback Jack Westover's sister bet $5 on a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup during training camp.
The bet on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX result earned Jack Westover's sister an $18,000 payout.
Jack Westover is a Washington native, played for the Huskies, and joined the Patriots after being cut by Seattle.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Drake Maye appeared at the Patriots' send-off rally despite missing practice due to illness and shoulder injury.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel praised the team's success, highlighting quarterback Drake Maye's contributions.
The Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on February 8 at Levi's Stadium with a 6:30 p.m. kickoff.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the milestone 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live' on January 31, 2026.
Former 'SNL' star Pete Davidson appeared in the political cold open as White House border czar Tom Homan.
Stellan Skarsgård made appearances during the show, supporting host and son Alexander Skarsgård's performance.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Mike Macdonald, Seahawks head coach, grew up in Scituate and originally dreamed of managing the Red Sox.
Macdonald, who moved from Massachusetts to Georgia, later transitioned into coaching, leading to his NFL career.
Since becoming Seahawks head coach in 2024, Macdonald has achieved a 24-10 regular-season record and a Super Bowl appearance.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots held a Super Bowl LX send-off rally at Gillette Stadium with speeches by Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
The team will fly from T.F. Green Airport to California for the Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks on February 8.
Patriots are underdogs with betting odds favoring Seahawks by 4.5 points for the upcoming Super Bowl LX.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises the New England Patriots culture, encouraging free agents to join the team this offseason.
The Patriots have improved appeal for free agents due to a Super Bowl berth and significant salary cap space.
Notable free agents available include George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips, who could further bolster the Patriots roster.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with $63 million guaranteed by the Patriots in 2025.
Williams contributed significantly in the postseason, recording two sacks and nine pressures according to Next Gen Stats.
Williams is ranked eighth in Patriots history for best free-agent signings, with standout performances in his first season.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before the deadline, as reported by Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst.
Nets center Nic Claxton and Mavericks center Daniel Gafford are potential trade targets for the Celtics.
Boston interested in various players, including Kings' guard Keon Ellis and Pelicans' center Yyves Missi.
